0.Summary: "Avoid a fast food job if possible."
0.Pros: Flexible schedules but that's about it.

1.Cons: Sometimes will get stuck with poor managment

2.Cons: Horrible managmentSaid i quit when i did not

3.Pros: Flexible scheduling, competitive pay, paid vacation time

4.Summary: "better than many other fast food jobs"
4.Pros: fast paced; flexible hours; fairly easy to switch shifts or get rid of a shift; a lot of customer service experience; learning general people skills; managers almost always give you the time off requested; opportunity to become proficient at multi-tasking
4.Cons: stressful at times; many managers lacking basic management skills including professionalism and courtesy, even toward customers; meager, infrequent raises, regardless of performance; little to no positive feedback from management; becoming a manager seems to entail being berated by upper management for an array of everyday slip-ups and incidentals that are beyond lower management's control, which is often passed down via bad attitudes to crew. This is why, although I have worked there for almost 5 years and have many skills and qualities to contribute as a manager, I am still crew. (in addition to the workload of college)

5.Pros: Great way to start gaining skills
5.Cons: Management sucked and they would just lounge around and do nothing

6.Pros: You get to interact with other people

7.Cons: Two week notice to request off work.

8.Pros: The best was that I was all cool with all my coworkers and whatever was extra you coulf of keep for break time.
8.Cons: The worst was the super duper hungry customers, they actually would scream at you in the drive thru and get mad so fast when they are speaking so low.

9.Pros: Locations worldwide. Great management training. Steady work.
9.Cons: No support from upper management. Low Pay. No Medical Benefits. No Vacations. No Holiday premium pay. No set shift, sometimes work day, swing, and graveyard all in one week, often get off of graveyard in the morning and scheduled to return by 2 in the afternoon.
